roleset.name: to adjust, adapt

example.name: all arguments
example.text: Details of the plan , which [*T*-2] would go into effect in 1993 , are sketchy , but each player would apparently be paid [*-1][a base salary]-1 keyed [*] -1 to his position and ability .

roleset.note: KEY-V NOTES: Frames file for 'key' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from key.01-v predicate notes)

roleset.name: important, be 'the key' to something

example.name: arg1
example.text: The dyes they have are key too ... I wonder what I have to do to get them

roleset.note: KEY-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. (from key.01-j)

roleset.name: enter on a keyboard

example.name: All args
example.text: Sally keyed in the code on her alarm system but the police were still alerted.

roleset.note: Based on Bolt data. No VN or FN classes
